content.description:
Pull crux moves off the ground, shared with

Evolutionary Throwback

, onto a ledge and then traverse right ino the obvious chimney sytem that splits the formation.

With a low crux this is not an unreasonable solo and can also be used as a downclimb.
content.location: Chimney in the center of the southwest face.

content.description: Two short sections to this fun climb. The first bit is easy hands with good pro. Then an awkward step across to get underneath the wide bit, also well protected. The crux for me was getting established up into the bombay squeeze. Not much pro here but very secure once you're in it. Lassoed a flake for an anchor. Downclimb might have been 4th class.

climbs.name: Evolutionary Throwback
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Peggy Buckey, John Thackray, 03/87

content.description:
Not a bad route, at least as good if not better than it's neighbors.

Up onto a ledge and follow thin face past three bolts to a horizontal crack, small cams, go left and finish up the arete past a piton.

Crux lies between bots 2 and 3.
content.location: The face left of Barnie Rubble

climbs.name: Barnie Rubble
climbs.fa: Alan Roberts, Maria Cranor, and Darryl Nakahira, 1980

content.description: This is the most obvious line on the formation.  It is a recessed hand jam.
content.location: Obvious left-facing corner in the middle of the formation.
